title: Marriage sign
content:
hello,

does anyone have examples on how a marriage sign (the two overlapping rings) should look in a Didonic typeface? Does it have contrast? It should somehow match the dagger sign as we use it together in genealogy charts.

Thanks in advance,

Georg

 [‹ Best way to preserve old metal type?](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121221648/http:/www.typophile.com/node/29281 "Go to previous forum topic") [Font ID: Narrow Script on old Graphis cover ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121221648/http:/www.typophile.com/node/37621 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Reetsde

comments.content:
Not exactly Didone, but these are some genealogical symbols and Aa for comparison from Computer Modern (the LaTeX font).

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121221648im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/cmu-genealogical_4871.png)

Note that they use the Latin Cross (U+271D) rather than the Dagger for death symbol.

Cheers,  
Jens
